climbs.name: Amadeus
climbs.fa: Dave Clay, Karl Nagy, Tim Friesen   Oct '84

content.description:
This 2 pitch mixed route rarely forms as a pure ice route, so bring a small rock rack with ya. Climb up the "approche pitch" to the base of a left facing corner, using a single bolt as a belay. 
 
P1.  Up and left to the base of the ice, utilizing the fixed gear along the way.  If you get lost, just look for all the crampon scratches on the rock!  M5 20 meters
P2.  From a fixed belay on the far left wall of the ice, head straight up on variable ice to a bolted belay on the far left wall at the top of the ice.  WI4 35 meters.

Note:  This route can be avi threatened from above.  Check the local conditions before you head up. 
2nd Note: If you head straight up from the base of the first pitch, the line goes at M6, on all rock gear.  
3rd Note:  Double 60s will get you back to the ground from the top of P2

Park as for Barrier Bluff rock climbs at the pullout on the east side of 40, about 1 km south of the Dam day use area.  Hike up the obvious trail to the rock climbing zones.  keep hiking uphill along the left side of the drainage, then eventually in the drainage and to the base of the climb. About a 1hr approche. 
fixed gear, bolted belays.
All routes that don't belong in an existing sub-area that is usually all sport climbs.
